title: v0.2.10 (#166)
message:
v0.2.10 (#166)

* Simple OVP SessionProvider (#142)

* Introducing SimpleKalturaOvpMediaProvider.

This class simplifies common OVP use-cases.

* Simplified basic demo app.

* Simplified the SimpleKalturaOvpMediaProvider further.

Taking advantage of KalturaOvpMediaProvider's ability to generate an anonymous session if KS is not provided.

* Renamed SimpleKalturaOvpMediaProvider to SimpleOvpMediaProvider.

* Instead of a new class, use a factory method on KalturaOvpMediaProvider.

This takes care of initializing a session provider with an existing KS.

* Replaced Simple MediaEntryProvider with a Simple SessionProvider.

This approach is more versatile, and allows other components to use the simple session provider.

* Fixed codacy javadoc warning.

* Fix start position (#154)

* v0.2.4

* Bug fix for start position. The PlayerController.java will not assign the mediaConfig to its member in constructor.

* check for null before equals on media entry id

* revert gradle change (#156)

* Cuepoints update on started fix (#157)

* move cue point have calculation to started phase instead of init

* request adCuePoints only once

* send cue point in adInfo

* send cue points after 2 sec ad is running

* update adCuePoints only once

* clean ad break skip flag on destroy

* Split Ad Started from CUE POINTS CHANGED

* v0.2.5

* update java doc

* ver v0.2.6
upgrade support library

* cancel IMA timer onDestory

* NPE Protection

* ver 0.2.7

* add NPE protection

* ver 0.2.8

* add AD_DISPLAYED_AFTER_CONTENT_PAUSE

* Fixed crashing metadata parsing in KalturaOvpMediaProvider. (#163)

* add null protection
v0.2.9

* Update version.gradle

* Fixed change media with ExoPlayer+DRM (#165)

* Fix DRM change media (ExoPlayer).

* De-generalized DeferredDrmSessionManager and friends.

It's only used with FrameworkMediaCrypto anyway.

title: Fem 1109 (#138)
message:
Fem 1109 (#138)

* startPosition fix. Now the player will use the actual media duration as it available after the duration_changed event occurred, and not as it described in mediaEntry data object.

* DURATION_CHANGED event now sent from the onTimelineChanged method which is triggered by the exoplayer when we have all the metadata loaded and know the duration of the media.
prevDuration field is no needed, so removed.

title: null pointer protection on the mappedTrackInfo. There is a small chance that it…
message: null pointer protection on the mappedTrackInfo. There is a small chance that it will be null if prepare is called and at the same time application is trying to change track. So now, if the mappedTrackInfo is null the method will be exited, but warning will be logged.

title: When application is going background it is possible that onTracksChanged() is…
message:
When application is going background it is possible that onTracksChanged() is still called by the exoplayer. So it will try to update not existing TrackSelectionHelper.
Added null pointer protection in order to avoid this issue.

title: Bug fix.
message:
Bug fix.

The startPosition check should be in front of mediaConfig.getMediaEntry().getDuration() and not player.getDuration. Because the player.getDuration() in this stage is always Consts.Time_Unset.

title: PKTracks: (#72)
message:
PKTracks: (#72)

* PKTracks:
 Rename videoTracksInfo to videoTracks.
 Rename audioTracksInfo to audioTracks.
 Rename textTracksInfo to textTracks.
Also their getters

* Tracks:
In order to avoid casting of the track objects in the application, the PKTracks will hold now lists with the relevant type.
For example instead of List<BaseTrack> videoTracks it will be List<VideoTrack> videoTracks.

TrackSelectionHelper.java :
-  removed unnecessary casting.
 - updateSelectedTrackBitrate now have package local access
 - removed unused string.

* Tracks:
In order to avoid casting of the track objects in the application, the PKTracks will hold now lists with the relevant type.
For example instead of List<BaseTrack> videoTracks it will be List<VideoTrack> videoTracks.

Remove unnecessary casting in TracksController.java
TracksController.java become package local, also some of it public methods.

title: Fixes after code review :
message:
Fixes after code review :

ExoPlayerWrapper.java :

* firstPlay -> removed.
* rename for methods :
 sendEvent -> sendDistinctEvent (will send event only if it does not occurs event before)
 sendDuplicatedEvent -> sendEvent
 * change from log.e to log.w (when logging about unavailable renderers)
 * null pointer protections on all player.doSomething() methods(the exposed ones).
 also will print log.e () with description of method that is trying to use instance of the exoplayer that is null.

 PlayerController.java :
 * null pointer protections on all player.doSomething() methods(the exposed ones).
 also will print log.e () with description of method that is trying to use instance of the PlayerEngine.java that is null.

 TrackSelectionHelper.java:
 * naming changes:
 ADAPTIVE_PREFIX renamed to ADAPTIVE_SUFFIX.
 convertUniqueId() renamed to parseUniqueId()

message:

Refactor:
ExoPlayerWrapper.java:
* instead isTimelineStatic now we use more descriptive shouldResetPlayerPosition.
* added method sendDuplicatedEvent that responsible for sending events no matter if they already were sent. (Useful for cases like "volume_changed").
* Added changeVolume and replay implementation. changeVolume(float volume) will send event with volume that was applied, as parameter. replay() will seekTo(0) but seamlessly, without invoking "Seek" events. Also
  it will send "Replay" event.

* Javadoc for PlayerEngine.java

title: TrackSelectionHelper.java :
message:
TrackSelectionHelper.java :
major changes in the flow and the way data is passed to the application.
Now application receive event Tracks_Available, with tracksInfo as a parameter. trackInfo hold video/audio and subtitle trackInfo lists.
each item have unique id that player is expect to receive when application want to change track type. also it have isAdaptive field which describe if current track group can be played adaptive.
MainActivity.java :
implementing the trackInfo.

title: Added functionality to the trackSelection flow.
message:
Added functionality to the trackSelection flow.

+ Now application background is handled. When user  goes back from background the previously selected tracks are restored.
+ Application can sort and change order of the tracks. All she need to do is just to notify TrackSelectionHelper.java with OnTrackInfoChanged.customizeTrackInfo() with trackType and new order of the track selections.

title: Fixed ExoPlayer user-agent string.
message:
Fixed ExoPlayer user-agent string.

Sample:
PlayKit/1.0 com.kaltura.playkitdemo/1.0 (Linux;Android 7.1.1) ExoPlayerLib/2.0.4

"PlayKit" is hardcoded, "1.0" is PlayKit's versionName, as appears in its build.gradle
"com.kaltura.playkitdemo/1.0" is the application's packageName and versionName (as reported by Package Manager)
The rest comes from ExoPlayer itself.

ExoPlayer uses this string for all http interactions - media download (manifest, chunks) and license requests.

title: Master player fixes merge branch (#13)
message:
Master player fixes merge branch (#13)

* CustomExoPlayerView.java - instead of creating layout from resources, now is created programmatically.

* - Change in the event/state sending. Now will not send event until player was restored.
- Added fix to restore. now player will be restored only if was released before.
- Method name changed in PlayerEngine.java from "resume" => to "restore"
- Method name changed in PlayerEngine.java from "load" => to "prepare"
- Small change in the order of sending events:
 * now FIRST_PLAY will be sent from play method.
 * SEEKED will be sent before CAN_PLAY(in seeking scenario).

* - Small bug fixes in PlaybackControlsView.java - now after going to backround player restore to the proper position.

* + track data objects added.

* Fixes after merge from master

* Track info initial commit. !!!Not finished!!!

* Fixes after merge from master

* Start playback from specified position in MediaConfig.

* # Some changes in method naming and flow.

+ Player.java and PlayerEngine.java instead of release() method now have destroy() that actually DESTROY the whole player object.
+ release() method removed from Player.java, instead you have onApplicationPaused and onApplicationResumed that actually handling all the pause/resume states of the player, based on Android activity lifecycle.

* # Some changes in method naming and flow.

+ Player.java and PlayerEngine.java instead of release() method now have destroy() that actually DESTROY the whole player object.
+ release() method removed from Player.java, instead you have onApplicationPaused and onApplicationResumed that actually handling all the pause/resume states of the player, based on Android activity lifecycle.

* Switch to PKLog

title: # Some changes in method naming and flow.
message:
# Some changes in method naming and flow.

+ Player.java and PlayerEngine.java instead of release() method now have destroy() that actually DESTROY the whole player object.
+ release() method removed from Player.java, instead you have onApplicationPaused and onApplicationResumed that actually handling all the pause/resume states of the player, based on Android activity lifecycle.

title: Merge branch 'master' into feature/FEM-897 + some design changes to the phoenix provider
message:
Merge branch 'master' into feature/FEM-897 + some design changes to the phoenix provider

* master:
  Feature/fem 897 (#6)

title: Some across-the-board changes (#10)
message:
Some across-the-board changes (#10)

* Some across-the-board changes

1. Assert.shouldNeverHappen()
2. No more autoplay, since it's confusing
3. Added AdProvider and AdInfo (still not used; they are meant to be used by ad engines)
4. Plugin lifecycle methods use "onXYZ" style (onLoad, onUpdate, onDestroy)
5. Player event listeners are managed by the message bus
6. Player state change is also mapped to an event
7. PlayerController doesn't call prepare() from the constructor

Some other cleanups.

DemoApp:
1. Use MockMediaProvider because it's much easier to test with
2. Input json contains 3 variants of the same entry -- dash, mp4, hls

* Added Player.updatePluginConfig().

* Deleted the old MockMediaEntryProvider.

* Use Gson's JsonObject instead of org.json.JSONObject.

* Removed leftover "m" prefix in demo app.

title: - Small bug fixes in PlaybackControlsView.java - now after going to backround…
message: - Small bug fixes in PlaybackControlsView.java - now after going to backround player restore to the proper position.

title: - Change in the event/state sending. Now will not send event until player was restored.
message:
- Change in the event/state sending. Now will not send event until player was restored.
- Added fix to restore. now player will be restored only if was released before.
- Method name changed in PlayerEngine.java from "resume" => to "restore"
- Method name changed in PlayerEngine.java from "load" => to "prepare"
- Small change in the order of sending events:
 * now FIRST_PLAY will be sent from play method.
 * SEEKED will be sent before CAN_PLAY(in seeking scenario).

title: CustomExoPlayerView.java - instead of creating layout from resources, now is…
message: CustomExoPlayerView.java - instead of creating layout from resources, now is created programmatically.

title: API tweaks.
message:
API tweaks.

Renamed MediaEntry and MediaSource to PKMediaEntry and PKMediaSource, respectively.
MockMediaEntryProvider now really mimics what an actual provider will do.
JSON parsing of mock data to objects is done in MockMediaEntryProvider.
setAutoPlay(), getAutoPlay() were missing from the Player interface.
